basic.description: The Advanced Legal Research Course prepares students to research the law by introducing them to the basics of legal research in their own and in other relevant jurisdictions.  Students will study the courts and law making in Canada, the U.S., the U.K., and Europe as well as in an international context.  They will learn how primary sources from various jurisdiction come into being, how they are organized, and where they can be found. They will also learn about 1) secondary sources in law available in print and electronically, 2) sources in the humanities and social sciences including Statistics Canada information, and 3) the major legal databases in Canada. 3 credits, one term.
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: Advanced Legal Research

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: LAW 115B or Law 116B or Law 117B or Law 118B
